alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 1:55PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...River and small stream flooding caused by recent excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Jersey, including the following county, Bergen. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 151 PM EST, The Hackensack River at Rivervale Gauge remains in minor flood stage at 5.76 ft. Water levels will continue to recede below flood stage this afternoon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tenakill Brook, Overpeck Creek, Cherry Brook, Hackensack River and Hirshfeld Brook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
